subject: Version negotiation api middleware to include v2.3

values.-1: This patch needs further work before it can be merged
values.+1: Looks good to me, but someone else must approve

messages.message: Patch Set 1: Cherry Picked from branch master.
Patch Set 2: Published edit on patch set 1
Patch Set 3: Published edit on patch set 2

Patch Set 3: Code-Review-1

I would like to see test included (like I commented to the already merged :( master patch).

How do you think we should proceed with this? Revert the master, add the tests so we get clean cherry pick or add the tests in master as separate change and squash the two together for backports?

Patch Set 3: Code-Review+1

> I would like to see test included (like I commented to the already
 > merged :( master patch).

I think you are right for having a test in master, so +1 on that suggestion.

 > 
 > How do you think we should proceed with this? Revert the master,
 > add the tests so we get clean cherry pick or add the tests in
 > master as separate change and squash the two together for
 > backports?

I think this and the master change are complete in themselves because they are tackling the issue of not including the CURRENT in the version negotiation. From your suggestion, it is indeed very clear that we have shortage of testing coverage on such important pieces of code.

However, the stable/* branches are not going to see any more version bumps (say v2.3 will not be bumped to v2.4 in both liberty and mitaka. So, backport without a test for the current is sufficient and I would like to avoid changing these backports or avoid making any reverts to master as the issue in stable/* branches will be completely fixed using this backport and the 'claim' of status=FixReleased on the stable/* branch backports for the bug associated will be true.


tl;dr;
Adding test coverage for CURRENT can be another (new) commit on master and we need not backport that.

Patch Set 3: Code-Review-1

I have to agree with Erno, I'd like to have tests included in this. As for *how*, I think master merely needs a patch with the tests and have the two patches squashed for backport is the *best* choice. I don't want to revert master, then re-review everything. That seems... frivolous.

Patch Set 3:

> I have to agree with Erno, I'd like to have tests included in this.
 > As for *how*, I think master merely needs a patch with the tests
 > and have the two patches squashed for backport is the *best*
 > choice. I don't want to revert master, then re-review everything.
 > That seems... frivolous.

I would like to understand the reason for tests to be included in backport, in practical terms?

We are not going to bump to v2.4 in stable branches, then there's no real risk of making changes this particular part of code. Isn't the purpose of tests to avoid regression. The avoidance of regression is being done at the stable policy level (which comes before code merge) so, I think this patch is safe and pretty complete.
Uploaded patch set 4.

Patch Set 4:

test has been added

Patch Set 4: Code-Review+2

Looks good to me, pending Zuul's agreement. ;)

Patch Set 4:

> Looks good to me, pending Zuul's agreement. ;)

Thanks Ian!

Patch Set 4: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1

Thanks for including the tests. And sorry for the delay providing my reasoning.

So if we see this critical enough to backport to both support phase stable branches I think it's critical enough to test for any accidental regressions. lets say we would have sec fix somewhere in our api path causing fix to be merged with limited reviewer visibility, there is always possibility that something slips and breaks the behavior. Having the test in stable branches as well will ensure that such regression will not go unnoticed. Thanks for understanding.
